JUnit does this:

setUp
try {
    runTest
}
finally {
    tearDown
}

Whate=
ver runTest does is a "test". If you call five methods inside runTest, that=
's one test, even if you wanted it to be five.

>1) Am I doing something so=
 obviously wrong that I cannot see it?
>    (This is always possible! <G>)
=

If you want setUp and tearDown to be called before and after each "test" m=
ethod, then you cannot override runTest to call them both. Create a TestSui=
te.

>2) Do both static and dynamic invocation call setUp()/tearDown
>    b=
efore/after each test?

Not sure what you mean here, but as long as you don=
't override runTest, then yes.

TestRunner? If so, how
>    would I modify the example to specify which tes=
ts, and then
>    invoke the TestRunner? By using TestSuite.addTest("testNa=
me")?
